commit_message:
Allow restricting access rules

Access rules can now have the visibility of sensible fields
restricted, as well as the deletion can be prevented.

To do so, two new parameters were implemented in the access create
command: `restrict_visibility` and `restrict_deletion`.

In order to drop the delete restriction, users must specify
the `unrestrict` option while issuing the share access delete
command.

Depends-On: Iea422c9d6bc99a81cd88c5f4b7055d6a1cf97fdc

Change-Id: I31899a563c621e6f799e320fd990f9e510a8a9cc

commit_message:
volume: Add Extension to volume v2 API

Makes our lives easier for migrating OSC, since volume v2 is still a
thing is some areas.

We reorder some methods in the v2 proxy, while we're here.

Change-Id: I1e4528f5a5d8e2caaaf204792ddcee7267e4c2e9
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/34/885134/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack.block_storage.v2 import extension as _extension # ====== QUOTA SETS ====== # ====== VOLUME METADATA ====== # ====== SNAPSHOT METADATA ====== # ====== EXTENSIONS ====== def extensions(self): """Return a generator of extensions :returns: A generator of extension :rtype: :class:`~openstack.block_storage.v3.extension.Extension` """ return self._list(_extension.Extension) # ====== UTILS ====== def wait_for_status( self, res, status='available', failures=None, interval=2, wait=120, callback=None, ): """Wait for a resource to be in a particular status. :param res: The resource to wait on to reach the specified status. The resource must have a ``status`` attribute. :type resource: A :class:`~openstack.resource.Resource` object. :param status: Desired status. :param failures: Statuses that would be interpreted as failures. :type failures: :py:class:`list` :param interval: Number of seconds to wait before to consecutive checks. Default to 2. :param wait: Maximum number of seconds to wait before the change. Default to 120. :param callback: A callback function. This will be called with a single value, progress. :returns: The resource is returned on success. :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceTimeout` if transition to the desired status failed to occur in specified seconds. :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceFailure` if the resource has transited to one of the failure statuses. :raises: :class:`~AttributeError` if the resource does not have a ``status`` attribute. """ failures = ['error'] if failures is None else failures return resource.wait_for_status( self, res, status, failures, interval, wait, callback=callback, ) def wait_for_delete(self, res, interval=2, wait=120, callback=None): """Wait for a resource to be deleted. :param res: The resource to wait on to be deleted. :type resource: A :class:`~openstack.resource.Resource` object. :param interval: Number of seconds to wait before to consecutive checks. Default to 2. :param wait: Maximum number of seconds to wait before the change. Default to 120. :param callback: A callback function. This will be called with a single value, progress. :returns: The resource is returned on success. :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceTimeout` if transition to delete failed to occur in the specified seconds. """ return resource.wait_for_delete( self, res, interval, wait, callback=callback, )

The resource must have a ``status`` attribute. :type resource: A :class:`~openstack.resource.Resource` object. :param status: Desired status. :param failures: Statuses that would be interpreted as failures. :type failures: :py:class:`list` :param interval: Number of seconds to wait before to consecutive checks. Default to 2. :param wait: Maximum number of seconds to wait before the change. Default to 120. :param callback: A callback function. This will be called with a single value, progress. :returns: The resource is returned on success. :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceTimeout` if transition to the desired status failed to occur in specified seconds. :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceFailure` if the resource has transited to one of the failure statuses. :raises: :class:`~AttributeError` if the resource does not have a ``status`` attribute. """ failures = ['error'] if failures is None else failures return resource.wait_for_status( self, res, status, failures, interval, wait, callback=callback, ) def wait_for_delete(self, res, interval=2, wait=120, callback=None): """Wait for a resource to be deleted. :param res: The resource to wait on to be deleted. :type resource: A :class:`~openstack.resource.Resource` object. :param interval: Number of seconds to wait before to consecutive checks. Default to 2. :param wait: Maximum number of seconds to wait before the change. Default to 120. :param callback: A callback function. This will be called with a single value, progress. :returns: The resource is returned on success. :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceTimeout` if transition to delete failed to occur in the specified seconds. """ return resource.wait_for_delete( self, res, interval, wait, callback=callback, )

subject: Image filters should be dict not set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-25 10:49:35.000000000', 'files': ['ci/roles/image/tasks/main.yml', 'plugins/modules/image.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack/commit/0a371445ebd795470a234e19cfb2536701f71814', 'message': "Image filters should be dict not set

At the moment we generate a set as a filter for image checksums which
lead to AttributeError in SDK:
'set' object has no attribute 'keys'

With that we ensure that supllying checksum does not cause
module crash.

Change-Id: I490f51950592f62c9ad81806593340779bf6dbdb
"}]
commit_message:
Image filters should be dict not set

At the moment we generate a set as a filter for image checksums which
lead to AttributeError in SDK:
'set' object has no attribute 'keys'

With that we ensure that supllying checksum does not cause
module crash.

Change-Id: I490f51950592f62c9ad81806593340779bf6dbdb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack refs/changes/88/889388/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix volume attachment with multiple HA pairs

This patch fixes the volume attachement operation filtering
the WWPNs that are passed to os-brick according to the HA pair
where the volume is created.

Closes-Bug: #1990846
Change-Id: I4cf37075b5bb9b57e92950f428ed4a240850ab88

deleted_lines: import timedef _call_client_and_retry( client, url, retry_on=None, call_retries=3, retry_wait=2, **kwargs ): """Method to provide retry operations. Some APIs utilize HTTP errors on certain operations to indicate that the resource is presently locked, and as such this mechanism provides the ability to retry upon known error codes. :param object client: The client method, such as: ``self.baremetal_client.post`` :param string url: The URL to perform the operation upon. :param integer retry_on: A list of error codes that can be retried on. The method also supports a single integer to be defined. :param integer call_retries: The number of times to retry the call upon the error code defined by the 'retry_on' parameter. Default: 3 :param integer retry_wait: The time in seconds to wait between retry attempts. Default: 2 :returns: The object returned by the client call. """ # NOTE(TheJulia): This method, as of this note, does not have direct # unit tests, although is fairly well tested by the tests checking # retry logic in test_baremetal_node.py. log = _log.setup_logging('shade.http') if isinstance(retry_on, int): retry_on = [retry_on] count = 0 while count < call_retries: count += 1 try: ret_val = client(url, **kwargs) except exc.OpenStackCloudHTTPError as e: if retry_on is not None and e.response.status_code in retry_on: log.debug( 'Received retryable error %(err)s, waiting ' '%(wait)s seconds to retry', {'err': e.response.status_code, 'wait': retry_wait}, ) time.sleep(retry_wait) continue else: raise # Break out of the loop, since the loop should only continue # when we encounter a known connection error. return ret_val

commit_message:
Return previous result of processed broker requests

Instead of returning an empty dict for already processed
broker requests, store the result and return it. This works
around issues in charms like ceph-fs that spin indefinitely
waiting for the response to a request that never arrives.

Closes-Bug: #2031414
Change-Id: Ie86f007d76fe75cc07cf7a973eff3f535a11dbe7

commit_message:
db: Replace use of backref

Per the SQLAlchemy docs [1]:

  The relationship.backref keyword should be considered legacy, and use
  of relationship.back_populates with explicit relationship() constructs
  should be preferred.

A blog post is available to explain what's going on here [2] and might
be worth a read. The learnings from that blog post do have the benefit
of allowing us to simplify some existing relationships that had
unnecessary arguments defined.

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/orm/backref.html
[2] https://that.guru/blog/sqlalchemy-relationships-without-foreign-keys/

Change-Id: I882e9a918ab1a44b205fc86bbcbb6fef5209ab76
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set GLOBAL_VENV=false to fix broken gate jobs

Set GLOBAL_VENV=false in neutron-tempest-plugin-base
job definition to fix gate jobs broken by devstack
change [0].

Had to make the neutron-tempest-plugin-dynamic-routing-*
jobs non-voting as they are failing on the master branch
check queue. Work is still ongoing on a fix.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/558930

Closes-bug: #2031415
Related-bug: #2031526
Change-Id: I2cab7e9169ca6ddaea8b580dbb995e0886bd93c1

commit_message:
Fix unsafe interpolation in exec command

This addresses the following warning in the lint tests, recently
revealed by the fix in puppet-lint.

~~~
unsafe interpolation of variable '<parameter>' in exec command
~~~

To avoid an unexpected behavior caused by a flat string containing
multiple arguments, this enforces usage of array values.

Change-Id: I829e6095d96ae8bedd8ce480bf088fd759b7b56d

commit_message:
Fix unsafe interpolation in exec command

This addresses the following warning in the lint tests, recently
revealed by the fix in puppet-lint.

~~~
unsafe interpolation of variable '<parameter>' in exec command
~~~

To avoid an unexpected behavior caused by a flat string containing
multiple arguments, this enforces usage of array values.

Also, this updates the db sync class to append the config file to
the command instead of inserting it. The current implementation allows
users to run a different subcommand, which is not safe.

Change-Id: I0d37d29899d3e83348b9e1668b28cfa748731404
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/43/892843/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Fix unsafe interpolation in exec command

This addresses the following warning in the lint tests, recently
revealed by the fix in puppet-lint.

~~~
unsafe interpolation of variable '<parameter>' in exec command
~~~

To avoid an unexpected behavior caused by a flat string containing
multiple arguments, this enforces usage of array values.

commit_message:
WIP: Provide a mechanism for virtual kayobe enviroments

This adds an env-path option to kayobe. Kayobe will source this file
into its enviroment prior to running any commands.

When you pip install your config with the -e flag we can detect the config
source location. This reduces the number of steps needed to use kayobe i.e you
don't need to set KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH and allows you to switch kayobe
environments by simply changing virtualenvs.

Change-Id: I7a297236d184967fcb48187a64e366617b689e9f
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/655424
Story: 2004367
Task: 30587

commit_message:
WIP: Only generate relevant configuration in ml2_conf.ini

On compute nodes we end up with some neutron-server configuration in
ml2_conf.ini. This change adds logic to only generate it when necessary.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ic3c2c1c780973e46450c93bee83a59b72892ddd7

Infra VMs: Support deployment on baremetal seed

Running the seed as a VM is optional. This allows you to make
use of infrastructure VMs on a baremetal seed.

commit_message:
Make SNAT iptables rules persistent

SNAT rules are created on the seed hypervisor or seed host to allow
routing via this host immediately after provisioning overcloud hosts.
These rules are not persistent, so may disappear after a reboot. This
can lead to a loss of network connectivity after provisioning control
plane hosts.

This change adds a new role, iptables-persist, that persists all active
iptables rules. The role is executed in the SNAT playbook.

This role was adapted from Zuul's persistent-firewall role [1].

[1] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/persistent-firewall

Change-Id: I8e485d0ff5b0030d1d91c9d21417ede27c2ee2e6
Story: 2006487
Task: 36433
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/39/679739/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # IPTables Persist This role makes all active IPTables and IP6Tables rules persistent. The role was adapted from Zuul's [persistent-firewall](https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/persistent-firewall) role.

commit_message:
service-ks-register: ensure all user roles exist

service_ks_register_user_roles is a list of user role assignments.
Previously the roles listed were not created prior to assigning them.
This change ensures they exist.

Change-Id: I9140083f41272515d4eca93e9310165bdf8add96
TrivialFix

commit_message:
Add fluentd_enable_watch_timer

By default, the watch timer in Fluentd is set to True.
To save CPU and I/O consumption this can be set to False.

When the watch timer is disabled, in_tail relies entirely
on inotify. In certain constellations, this may not work
reliably. In these cases, the watch timer is activated.

To be able to react in such cases, the watch timer must
be configurable accordingly.

Change-Id: Ic8ce6fbc3ed8f31d5d090e114b35703532679729
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/09/785309/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: enable_watch_timer {{ fluentd_enable_watch_timer }}

commit_message:
Modifies openvswitch tasks to exclude nodes with no openvswitch services

Modifies when clauses of OpenVSwitch post-config tasks. This is to make
sure the nodes targeted by them actually contain the services for which
commands are trying to be run.

Closes-Bug: #1971488
Change-Id: I97c74ad0279126747a836021ddb5b7f79440096c
Signed-off-by: Juan Pablo Suazo <jsuazo@whitestack.com>

commit_message:
nova-cell: add external_ceph_always_copy_cinder_keyring parameter

With the parameter ``external_ceph_always_copy_cinder_keyring``
the Ceph keyring from Cinder can be made available in the Nova
service, even if Ceph itself is not enabled as a storage backend
via the ``cinder_backend_ceph`` parameter there.

Change-Id: Ic5ec8de858960b6294e7cfbd1113e48f5dc40099

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-05-25 11:49:42.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/loadbalancer/handlers/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/haproxy-config/tasks/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/firewalld-immediate-c2abf09977c455a9.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/2fbb067b562c2c5b520b48313daeb8df7148cdb0', 'message': 'Apply public firewalld rules immediately

Previously, firewalld rules were applied to configuration, then
firewalld reloaded to pick up all the new rules. Reloading firewalld can
be disruptive because it sets all chains to a DROP policy while building
up its firewall rules, breaking open connections.

This change switches to applying rules both permanently (to config) and
immediately, such that no reload is required.

Change-Id: I8e48b7827b33bdd2061d0e89c905bea8e29f60e8
'}]
commit_message:
Apply public firewalld rules immediately

Previously, firewalld rules were applied to configuration, then
firewalld reloaded to pick up all the new rules. Reloading firewalld can
be disruptive because it sets all chains to a DROP policy while building
up its firewall rules, breaking open connections.

This change switches to applying rules both permanently (to config) and
immediately, such that no reload is required.

Change-Id: I8e48b7827b33bdd2061d0e89c905bea8e29f60e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/65/884365/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Modifies public API firewalld rules to be applied immediately to a running firewalld service. This requires firewalld to be running, but avoids reloading firewalld, which is disruptive due to the way in which firewalld builds its firewall chains.

commit_message:
Don't template ceilometer event_definitions.yaml

Ceilometer provides its own event_definitions.yaml file which is
periodically updated by the project, and is used by Ceilometer services
by default. Not templating this file ensures that kolla-ansible does
not need to keep it in-sync, while retaining the ability for operators
to override its content if required.

Closes-Bug: #1920095
Change-Id: I39737e997fb308a781265c270668583222d42a50
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/21/872721/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes Ceilometer resource creation error messages. Error messages were caused by shipping an old event_definitions.yaml file with kolla-ansible. Now, event_definitions.yaml shipped with Ceilometer is used by default, unless operators provide an override file. `LP#1920095 <https://launchpad.net/bugs/1920095>`__

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/33/839633/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Ceph may encounter issues if SSL certificates are used. If self-signed certificates are used, verify that they are added to the local certificate authority. In Ubuntu, for example, this would be copying the certificates in ``/etc/kolla/certificates/private/`` to ``/usr/local/share/ca-certificates/`` and issue the ``update-ca-certificates`` command. Or if debugging, you can temporarily disable SSL verification by setting `rgw_verify_ssl` to false. $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_verify_ssl true
deleted_lines: $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_verify_ssl false

commit_message:
remove untils.spawn_n

This change removes nova.utils.spawn_n and replaces
all current usage with spawn. As a result of this change
the 7 remaining tests that previously leaked greenlets
started leaking greenthreads. As greenthread leaks are errors
the final 7 leaks in the functional tests have been fixed.

Now that all leaks are fixed the fixture is updated to raise if
the greenpool has any running greenlets/greenthreads.
The tox config is also simplified as a result.

Change-Id: I97ec9cb4ce27ef245f49b99e542411060ec8a910

commit_message:
Use upper-constraint in doc generation

Currently doc jobs are broken because the latest sphinx 7.2.0 is not
compatible with the latest release of openstackdocstheme.

This updates the docs/releasenotes target to use the global upper
constraints to avoid that issue.

Change-Id: I075240f47e4de34182a0fc68f92ed62ae84a277a
Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Implement heat 'stack evnet list'

Add get_stack_events function to support retrieving stack events
Add StackEvents Class to support retrieving stack events
Also implement unit test code

Change-Id: I471ae3f0f1db0108094caa1411e73830677b2ea3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/32/892832/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack.orchestration.v1 import stack_events as _stack_events def show_resource_data(self, stack, resource_name, **query): return self._find( _resource.Resource, name_or_id=stack, resource_name=resource_name, **query ) def get_stack_events(self, stack, resource_name=None, **attr): """Get a stack events :param stack: The value can be the ID of a stack or an instance of :class:`~openstack.orchestration.v1.stack.Stack` :param resource_name: The name of resource If the resource_name is not None, the base_path changes. :returns: A generator of stack_events objects :rtype: :class:`~openstack.orchestration.v1.stack_events.StackEvents` """ if isinstance(stack, _stack.Stack): obj = stack else: obj = self._get(_stack.Stack, stack) if resource_name: base_path = '/stacks/%(stack_name)s/%(stack_id)s/resources/%(resource_name)s/events' return self._list( _stack_events.StackEvents, stack_name=obj.name, stack_id=obj.id, resource_name=resource_name, base_path=base_path, **attr ) return self._list( _stack_events.StackEvents, stack_name=obj.name, stack_id=obj.id, **attr )

commit_message:
Don't provide MTU value in metadata service if DHCP is enabled

For networks with subnets with enabled DHCP service don't provide
mtu value in the metadata. That way cloud-init will not configure it
"statically" in e.g. netplan's config file and guest OS will use MTU
value provided by the DHCP service.


Closes-Bug: #1899487
Change-Id: Ib775c2210349b72b3dc033554ac6d8b35b8d2d79
(cherry picked from commit 6bdc79af30151f683c0f462bc6c69da30ebcbcf9)

commit_message:
freezer-scheduler config dir permission change

Commit [1] deletes the authorization operation on the /etc/freezer
directory, causing the freezer-scheduler to have no permission when
creating the jobs_dir directory in the /etc/freezer directory.
This pathch changes permissions of /etc/freezer/scheduler before
freezer-scheduler startup. So that, freezer-scheduler process can
startup successfully.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/722102

Closes-Bug: #2031953
Depends-on: I9c7fea3e0f70ff2e15394e99e26d21c548b95b16
Change-Id: I360990096042e857813b4890bddd67dd4bed99e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/45/892045/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: jobs_dir = /var/lib/freezer/scheduler/conf.d

commit_message:
Fix ovn-metadata agent sync of unused namespaces

metadata_namespaces contained datapath uuid and not the
neutron network uuid. This broke the logic for namespaces clean up,
resulting in all namespaces getting torn down and recreated at each
metadata agent sync.

Closes-Bug: #2031184
Change-Id: I58dd1973b73aa006234e7b808b6a3f357182a4b3
(cherry picked from commit 87b2f34a98349012ecceed0e54dc766d36024685)

commit_message:
Use service role only to acess Assisted volume snapshots API

Assisted volume snapshots API is service-to-service API
and nova is changing its default permission to 'service'
role
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/892635

After nova change, we do not need to keep admin role in
the Tempest creds to access this API instead, only service
role is right token to use.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/892635
Change-Id: I56ed7663ae1ffe4377a644d307e02921c3982fa5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/39/892639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: credentials = ['primary', 'admin', ['service_user', 'service']]
deleted_lines: # TODO(gmann): Remove the admin access to service user # once nova change the default of this API to service # role. To merge the nova changing the policy default # we need to use token with admin as well as service # role and later we can use only service token. credentials = ['primary', 'admin', ['service_user', 'admin', 'service']]

commit_message:
db: Update 'select()' calls

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  The legacy calling style of select() is deprecated and will be removed
  in SQLAlchemy 2.0.  Please use the new calling style described at
  select().

For more information, refer to http://sqlalche.me/e/b8d9.

Change-Id: I59e694358dfb3e6e6d0412a5519a412404260937
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/07/888307/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: sub_query = sa_sql.select([sub_query]) sub_query = sa_sql.select([sub_query]) acl_user_sub_query = sa_sql.select([acl_user_sub_query]) acl_sub_query = sa_sql.select([acl_sub_query]) sub_query = sa_sql.select([sub_query])

commit_message:
Fix typo in selenium test

For selenium v3 the proper syntax is

link = browser.find_element_by_link_text(link_name)

not

 link = browser.find_element_by_text_link(link_name)

Change-Id: I9f6062bae5caaa840208e90e8f29b63bf52d113b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/09/892809/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: db: Replace use of reverse cascades
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-06-17 02:17:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/d6359b941d8d0ec14ce7774d323621b69907d029', 'message': 'db: Replace use of reverse cascades

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  "SecretStoreMetadatum" object is being merged into a Session along the
  backref cascade path for relationship "Secret.secret_store_metadata";
  in SQLAlchemy 2.0, this reverse cascade will not take place.  Set
  cascade_backrefs to False in either the relationship() or backref()
  function for the 2.0 behavior; or to set globally for the whole
  Session, set the future=True flag

In effect, this means if you have a model that refers to another model,
creating/saving the former will no longer create/save the latter. We
have only one instance of this error - the error message above - and in
our case we are explicitly saving the 'Secret' instance before saving
the 'SecretStoreMetadatum' instance. As such, we can opt-in to the 2.0
behavior with no further changes. We do this for all relationships to be
safe.

More information on this issue can be found at [1].

[1] https://groups.google.com/g/sqlalchemy/c/VoY-qEiJA3U?pli=1

Change-Id: I4b4fa4c224113863643e16153478183447796146
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
db: Replace use of reverse cascades

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  "SecretStoreMetadatum" object is being merged into a Session along the
  backref cascade path for relationship "Secret.secret_store_metadata";
  in SQLAlchemy 2.0, this reverse cascade will not take place.  Set
  cascade_backrefs to False in either the relationship() or backref()
  function for the 2.0 behavior; or to set globally for the whole
  Session, set the future=True flag

In effect, this means if you have a model that refers to another model,
creating/saving the former will no longer create/save the latter. We
have only one instance of this error - the error message above - and in
our case we are explicitly saving the 'Secret' instance before saving
the 'SecretStoreMetadatum' instance. As such, we can opt-in to the 2.0
behavior with no further changes. We do this for all relationships to be
safe.

More information on this issue can be found at [1].

[1] https://groups.google.com/g/sqlalchemy/c/VoY-qEiJA3U?pli=1

Change-Id: I4b4fa4c224113863643e16153478183447796146
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/00/886300/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cascade="all, delete-orphan", cascade_backrefs=False) cascade="all, delete-orphan", cascade_backrefs=False) cascade="all, delete-orphan", cascade_backrefs=False) cascade="all, delete-orphan", cascade_backrefs=False) cascade="all, delete-orphan", cascade_backrefs=False) cascade="all, delete-orphan", cascade_backrefs=False, 'SecretACLUser', backref=orm.backref('secret_acl', lazy=False), cascade="all, delete-orphan", cascade_backrefs=False) 'ContainerACLUser', backref=orm.backref('container_acl', lazy=False), cascade="all, delete-orphan", cascade_backrefs=False)
deleted_lines: cascade="all, delete-orphan") cascade="all, delete-orphan") cascade="all, delete-orphan") cascade="all, delete-orphan") cascade="all, delete-orphan") cascade="all, delete-orphan" 'SecretACLUser', backref=orm.backref('secret_acl', lazy=False), cascade="all, delete-orphan") 'ContainerACLUser', backref=orm.backref('container_acl', lazy=False), cascade="all, delete-orphan")

commit_message:
tests: Enable SQLAlchemy 2.0 deprecation warnings

Well, sort of. We enable them but immediately filter out the ones we're
actually seeing, the rationale being that we can address these in a
piecemeal fashion without the risk of introducing new issues.

There's a bit more to be done here. However, the work done in oslo.db
and other projects [1] should provide a guide for how to resolve the
outstanding issues.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:sqlalchemy-20

Change-Id: I36a79377016a6913f2c63cac4c820ad8342ffbf6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/99/886299/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(stephenfin): Remove once we bump our upper-constraint to SQLAlchemy 2.0 SQLALCHEMY_WARN_20=1

commit_message:
Use service role only to access Server External Events API

Server External Events API is service-to-service API
and nova is changing its default permission to 'service'
role
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/892633

After nova change, we do not need to keep admin role in
the Tempest creds to access this API instead, only service
role is right token to use.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/892633
Change-Id: Id180474cf7db8c7ee48a2e07e8f8cef4752f34d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/42/892642/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: credentials = ['primary', ['service_user', 'service']]
deleted_lines: # TODO(gmann): Remove the admin access to service user # once nova change the default of this API to service # role. To merge the nova changing the policy default # we need to use token with admin as well as service # role and later we can use only service token. credentials = ['primary', 'admin', ['service_user', 'admin', 'service']]

commit_message:
Add command to force reset the state of RabbitMQ

This command can be invoked with ``kolla-ansible rabbitmq-reset-state``.
This is primarily designed to be used when enabling HA queues[1].

As such, this also updates the RabbitMQ documentation to use this
command.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/reference/message-queues/rabbitmq.html#high-availability

Change-Id: I6ad95a3618fc1a34af56657ef99ef14dc979f17a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/91/890391/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rabbitmq-reset-state Force reset the state of RabbitMQrabbitmq-reset-state(rabbitmq-reset-state) ACTION="Force reset the state of RabbitMQ" PLAYBOOK="${BASEDIR}/ansible/rabbitmq-reset-state.yml" ;;

commit_message:
[functional]Fix remaining greenlet leaks

We leak due to running background operations like server create, rebuild
and in one case a sleeping claim. So this patch removes the leaks by
making sure that the background operations stop before the test
finishes.

As there is no more leak in functional test too this patch makes the
leak an error there too.

Change-Id: I6905999050e8d09b772837034a212c534e9c3226
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/93/892793/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # All leaks of green threads have been resolved in the unit and functional # suitesetenv = {[testenv]setenv} # we do not have any greenlet leaks in functional tests so enforce that # by making greenlet leaks a failure. NOVA_RAISE_ON_GREENLET_LEAK=True
deleted_lines: # All simiple leaks of green threads have been resolved the remaining 7 # functional test failures where greenlet leaks happen are non trivial # to address as there is no obvious cause so they are ignored for now.

commit_message:
Remove pypy from bindep.txt

We haven't tested under pypy since 2020, and haven't done so
*successfully* for even longer.

As that was the only remaining set of packages in bindep.txt,
remove it entirely.

Related-Change: Ibc80d23846b364bfcd82043430ef71ad4b6e271b
Change-Id: I0e4abc482e546f36358f6085a6d5635490f4ac5c

commit_message:
Clean up CI jobs

We no longer need our own py311 job; there is now an openstack-tox-py311
included in openstack-python3-jobs (though we want to make it voting).

Additionally, that template has marked py39 and py310 jobs as voting, so
we no longer need to do that ourselves.

Change-Id: Ie964678af069d5255e463ef22b1b53957d28f918

commit_message:
make sure servers are sshable before performing instance actions

recently Ib0318bb3c55d05891f209af259e706fa66a3081f enabled
better test distribution across workers by spliting up
the ServerActionTestJSON class.

Since then test_get_console_output_server_id_in_shutoff_status
has been failing consitently in the nova_lvm job with empty
console output. This patch attempts to correct that
by ensuring the vm is sshable instead of just active.

Closes-Bug: #2028851
Change-Id: I7d2f33a7bc73d74c5a3cd205d5e3bc65a143e3bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/47/889847/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: [ceph-rgw] Use Helm toolkit functions for Ceph RGW probes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-22 16:31:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/9e8afcc6aa924cad292f048c0010dc931f15a387', 'message': '[ceph-rgw] Use Helm toolkit functions for Ceph probes

This change converts the readiness and liveness probes in the Ceph
charts to use the functions from the Helm toolkit rather than
having hard-coded probe definitions. This allows probe configs to
be overridden in values.yaml without rebuilding charts.

Change-Id: Ia09d06746ee06f96f61a479b57a110c94e77c615
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-08-24 12:03:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/2cd0d90b6cee46c5e4abc8cff870f1cbd80c0b2c', 'message': '[ceph-rgw] Use Helm toolkit functions for Ceph RGW probes

This change converts the readiness and liveness probes in the Ceph
RGW chart to use the functions from the Helm toolkit rather than
having hard-coded probe definitions. This allows probe configs to

commit_message:
[ceph-rgw] Use Helm toolkit functions for Ceph RGW probes

This change converts the readiness and liveness probes in the Ceph
RGW chart to use the functions from the Helm toolkit rather than
having hard-coded probe definitions. This allows probe configs to
be overridden in values.yaml without rebuilding charts.

Change-Id: Ia09d06746ee06f96f61a479b57a110c94e77c615

commit_message:
Changing formatter functions to cliff.columns.FormattableColumn

The latest version is generating the following warning:

(overcloud) [stack@undercloud ~]$ openstack volume list
/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/osc_lib/utils/__init__.py:515:
DeprecationWarning: The usage of formatter functions is now discouraged.
Consider using cliff.columns.FormattableColumn instead. See reviews
linked with bug 1687955 for more detail.
  warnings.warn(

Fixed the code of volume.py to reflect that by changing
the formatters={'metadata': format_columns.DictColumn}
to formatters={'metadata': cliff_columns.FormattableColumn}

Change-Id: Iaa5fbb5f6468c7209a9fed2f69ed341fecbb58d4
Signed-off-by: Alexon Oliveira <alolivei@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Changing formatter functions to cliff.columns.FormattableColumn

The latest version is generating the following warning:

(overcloud) [stack@undercloud ~]$ openstack volume list
/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/osc_lib/utils/__init__.py:515:
DeprecationWarning: The usage of formatter functions is now discouraged.
Consider using cliff.columns.FormattableColumn instead. See reviews
linked with bug 1687955 for more detail.
  warnings.warn(

Fixed the code of volume.py to reflect that by changing
the formatters={'metadata': format_columns.DictColumn}
to formatters={'metadata': cliff_columns.FormattableColumn}

Change-Id: I680436d522d6f788af23229fa80e7d88dba15f20
Signed-off-by: Alexon Oliveira <alolivei@redhat.com>

subject: [functional] Avoid leaking greenlet in UnifiedLimits tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-25 13:55:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/test_unified_limits.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0ae1802db6530b2c877802ba8e1a82da4ad35f2a', 'message': '[functional] Avoid leaking greenlet in UnifiedLimits tests

The leak tests just start a server create and the finish so I think
the actual conductor thread leaks. If I add a bit of sleep to the end of
these test cases then the leak disappears. Unfortunately adding the
sleep at the greenpool fixture does not have this effect. So instead I
added delete_server calls to the end of these tests as those are nicer
than sleeps and has the same effect regarding the leak.

We are down to 3 leaking functional test

Change-Id: I070390c695283bdd9b87cd879aa2a9257ee7bdfb
'}]
commit_message:
[functional] Avoid leaking greenlet in UnifiedLimits tests

The leak tests just start a server create and the finish so I think
the actual conductor thread leaks. If I add a bit of sleep to the end of
these test cases then the leak disappears. Unfortunately adding the
sleep at the greenpool fixture does not have this effect. So instead I
added delete_server calls to the end of these tests as those are nicer
than sleeps and has the same effect regarding the leak.

We are down to 3 leaking functional test

Change-Id: I070390c695283bdd9b87cd879aa2a9257ee7bdfb

commit_message:

commit_message:
Limit token expiration to application credential expiration

If a token is issued with an application credential we need to check
the expiration of the application credential to ensure that the token
does not outlive the application credential. This ensures that if the
token expiration is greaten than that of the application credential it
is reset to the expiration of the application credential and a warning
is logged. Please see CVE-2022-2447 for more information.

With direct cherry-pick, a non-existing module was being referenced. It
was fixed manually.

Closes-Bug: 1992183
Change-Id: If6f9f72cf25769d022a970fac36cead17b2030f2
(cherry picked from commit 8f999d1c1f54a903c1da648ecaa2ce44acdb1fd1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/09/862909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_application_credential_expiration_limits_token_expiration(self): expires_at = datetime.datetime.utcnow() + datetime.timedelta(minutes=1) app_cred = self._make_app_cred(expires=expires_at) app_cred_ref = self.app_cred_api.create_application_credential( app_cred) auth_data = self.build_authentication_request( app_cred_id=app_cred_ref['id'], secret=app_cred_ref['secret']) resp = self.v3_create_token(auth_data, expected_status=http.client.CREATED) token = resp.headers.get('X-Subject-Token') future = datetime.datetime.utcnow() + datetime.timedelta(minutes=2) with freezegun.freeze_time(future): self._validate_token(token, expected_status=http.client.UNAUTHORIZED)

commit_message:
Add an option to randomize LDAP urls list

Since LDAP is now readonly, the current behavior might be
unexpected. By randomizing the list, we assure a more gradual
failure scenario if the first server on the list (as specified
by the user) fails.

Change-Id: I23f31bd85443784013a6aa158d80c7aeeb343993
Closes-Bug: #1953622
Resolves: rhbz#2024602

commit_message:
Respect cached tokens issued before upgrade

Right after keystone is upgraded from Zed to 2023.1
attempt to use previously cached tokens fails with
AttributeError, as tokens do not have oauth2_thumbprint
attribute yet.

Thus, services misbehave until cache is exipred or flushed.

In order to prevent this from happening, we use safe
getattr() instead of just assuming that attribute is there.

Change-Id: I911fec106178ebf37e004767cf8d0bdc8f001297
Closes-Bug: #2029134

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-07 13:29:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/198de7f8c5799fe6eac3da07db791c15651d62c9', 'message': 'Force algo specific maximum length

The bcrypt algorithm that we use for password hashing silently
length limits the size of the password that is hashed giving the
user a false sense of security [0].  This patch adds a check
in the verify_length_and_trunc_password function for the hash in
use and updates the max_length accordingly, this will override
the configured value and log a warning if the password is truncated.

* tox.ini

[0]: https://passlib.readthedocs.io/en/stable/lib/passlib.hash.bcrypt.html#security-issues

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-08-22 13:13:56.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'keystone/conf/identity.py', 'releasenotes/notes/max-password-length-truncation-and-warning-bd69090315ec18a7.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/bcrypt_truncation_fix-674dc5d7f1e776f2.yaml', 'keystone/common/password_hashing.py', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/7852ca24a4eb86cb271ef7ec5e07f8f9c97f926d', 'message': 'Force algo specific maximum length & Properly trimm bcrypt hashed passwords

This is the squash of 2 patches related to bcrypt hashing settings.

1.
Force algo specific maximum length

The bcrypt algorithm that we use for password hashing silently
length limits the size of the password that is hashed giving the
user a false sense of security [0].  This patch adds a check
in the verify_length_and_trunc_password function for the hash in
use and updates the max_length accordingly, this will override
the configured value and log a warning if the password is truncated.

Conflicts:
* tox.ini

[0]: https://passlib.readthedocs.io/en/stable/lib/passlib.hash.bcrypt.html#security-issues

2.
Properly trimm bcrypt hashed passwords

bcrypt  hashing algorythm has a limitation on length of passwords it
can hash on 72 bytes. In [1] a password trimm to 54 symbols has been
implemented, which resulted in password being invalidated after the
keystone upgrade, since passwords are trimmed differently by bcrypt
itself, as well as len(str()) is not always equal to
len(str().encode()) as trimming should be done based on bytes and not
string itself.

With the change we return a byte object from
`verify_length_and_trunc_password`, so it does not need to
be encoded afterwards, since we need to strip based on bytes
rather then on length of the string.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/keystone/+/828595

Closes-Bug: #2028809
Related-Bug: #1901891

commit_message:
Force algo specific maximum length & Properly trimm bcrypt hashed passwords

This is the squash of 2 patches related to bcrypt hashing settings.

1.
Force algo specific maximum length

The bcrypt algorithm that we use for password hashing silently
length limits the size of the password that is hashed giving the
user a false sense of security [0].  This patch adds a check
in the verify_length_and_trunc_password function for the hash in
use and updates the max_length accordingly, this will override
the configured value and log a warning if the password is truncated.

Conflicts:
* tox.ini

[0]: https://passlib.readthedocs.io/en/stable/lib/passlib.hash.bcrypt.html#security-issues

2.
Properly trimm bcrypt hashed passwords

bcrypt  hashing algorythm has a limitation on length of passwords it
can hash on 72 bytes. In [1] a password trimm to 54 symbols has been
implemented, which resulted in password being invalidated after the
keystone upgrade, since passwords are trimmed differently by bcrypt
itself, as well as len(str()) is not always equal to
len(str().encode()) as trimming should be done based on bytes and not
string itself.

With the change we return a byte object from
`verify_length_and_trunc_password`, so it does not need to
be encoded afterwards, since we need to strip based on bytes
rather then on length of the string.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/keystone/+/828595

Closes-Bug: #2028809
Related-Bug: #1901891
original change id: Iea95a3c2df041a0046647b3d3dadead1a6d054d1
(cherry picked from commit 6730c761d18aa547998f2add833c13f45f257fe7)
(cherry picked from commit 65f1fb6b4a54386f473369b05c8d10d77fb6710c)

Closes-bug: #1901891
Change-Id: I8d0bb2438b23227b5a66b94af6f8e198084fcd8d

commit_message:
fix(federation): allow using numerical group names

When using a numerical group name, the current codebase which
relies on ast.literal_eval does not account for the value
being a number.  Therefore, it can be parsed as a number and
fail in further steps since it will not be a list.

This patch adds a test to handle that use case and refactor the
code that leverages ast.literal_eval to be the same everywhere
so that it adds that fix everywhere.

Closes-Bug: #1992186
Change-Id: I665b7e0234650ba07e0d030a2d442d6599d0888a
(cherry picked from commit c70d0c33a5977ca7208fbadd876a646cd37ffb31)

commit_message:
fix(federation): allow using numerical group names

When using a numerical group name, the current codebase which
relies on ast.literal_eval does not account for the value
being a number.  Therefore, it can be parsed as a number and
fail in further steps since it will not be a list.

This patch adds a test to handle that use case and refactor the
code that leverages ast.literal_eval to be the same everywhere
so that it adds that fix everywhere.

Closes-Bug: #1992186
Change-Id: I665b7e0234650ba07e0d030a2d442d6599d0888a

commit_message:
introduce global greenpool

This change add a global greenpool which is used to manage
the greenthreads created via nova.utils.spawn(_n).

A test fixture is also added to use an isolated greenpool
which will raise an exception if a greenthread is leaked.
the fixture will optionally raise if greenlets are leaked.
This is enabled by unit test by default and is configurable
for functional tests.

This change removes all greenthread leaks from the unit
and functional tests that were detected. 7 functional
tests still leak greenlets but they have no obvious
cause. as such greenlet leaks are not treated as errors
for funtional tests by default. Greenthread leaks
are always treated as errors.
Set NOVA_RAISE_ON_GREENLET_LEAK=1|true|yes when invoking
tox to make greenlet leaks an error for functional tests.

Change-Id: I73b4684744b340bfb80da08537a745167ddea106

commit_message:
Change cloudkitty tempest plugin to not use the global venv

In the newest tempest [0] version, the dependencies are isolated
in a venv but the cloudkitty structure is not prepared to it
so for now, to avoid the CI breaking, we are disabling it
to keep the old behavior.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/558930

Change-Id: I662010fa99baf9288341ed6449f415fe27e490c4

commit_message:
Fixes SSL conflicts between relation and config data.

The fix adds event based handling of SSL configuration using charm
config and cleanup of SSL for relation and config based key/certs.
It also adds logical abstractions to analyse SSL setup and emit
relevant events.

Closes-Bug: 1952282
Change-Id: Ic486434526f639f5985cfe355e303c1d6ff5fa0d
Signed-off-by: utkarshbhatthere <utkarsh.bhatt@canonical.com>
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/1090
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-dashboard refs/changes/79/884479/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._request_certificates) self._configure_tls) def _request_certificates(self, event) -> None: event.defer() def _dashboard_set(self, prop, value) -> str: "Configure ceph dashboard properties" logger.debug("Setting Dashboard %s as %s" % (prop, value)) return self._run_cmd(['ceph', 'dashboard', prop, value]) def _configure_service_apis(self) -> None: """Configure related service APIs in ceph dashboard""" if self.unit.is_leader(): grafana_ep = self.config.get('grafana-api-url') if grafana_ep: self._dashboard_set('set-grafana-api-url', grafana_ep) alertmanager_conn = self.alertmanager.get_service_ep_data() if alertmanager_conn: self._dashboard_set( 'set-alertmanager-api-host', 'http://{}:{}'.format( alertmanager_conn['hostname'], alertmanager_conn['port'] )) prometheus_conn = self.prometheus.get_service_ep_data() if prometheus_conn: self._dashboard_set( 'set-prometheus-api-host', 'http://{}:{}'.format( prometheus_conn['hostname'], prometheus_conn['port'] )) self._configure_saml() hostname=socket.gethostname() ), str(self._get_bind_ip()) ) # configure grafana, prometheus and alertmanager API endpoints self._configure_service_apis() encoding=serialization.Encoding.PEM) + root_ca_chain) if not self.unit.is_leader(): logger.debug("Unit not leader, skipping saml config") return
deleted_lines: self._configure_dashboard) self._configure_dashboard) def request_certificates(self) -> None: self.request_certificates() self._configure_tls() hostname=socket.gethostname()), str(self._get_bind_ip())) if self.unit.is_leader(): grafana_ep = self.config.get('grafana-api-url') if grafana_ep: self._run_cmd([ 'ceph', 'dashboard', 'set-grafana-api-url', grafana_ep]) alertmanager_conn = self.alertmanager.get_service_ep_data() if alertmanager_conn: alertmanager_ep = 'http://{}:{}'.format( alertmanager_conn['hostname'], alertmanager_conn['port']) self._run_cmd([ 'ceph', 'dashboard', 'set-alertmanager-api-host', alertmanager_ep]) prometheus_conn = self.prometheus.get_service_ep_data() if prometheus_conn: prometheus_ep = 'http://{}:{}'.format( prometheus_conn['hostname'], prometheus_conn['port']) self._run_cmd([ 'ceph', 'dashboard', 'set-prometheus-api-host', prometheus_ep]) self._configure_saml() encoding=serialization.Encoding.PEM) + root_ca_chain)

subject: Raise error if producer configured with no valid tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-24 09:40:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/34b794535318846e61c8c5b4ae08294a9956f5ab', 'message': 'Raise error if producer configured to run no tasks

There is no legit reason to have the producer running
if there are no tasks running.

Change-Id: I05a69cf80785c912aaef2e29bfc0a1e5d57ceb6c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-08-24 09:55:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/7b38a5782f6b799230c6dc5e434c4cddafee12bc', 'message': 'Raise error if producer configured to run no tasks

There is no legit reason to have the producer running

commit_message:
Raise error if producer configured with no valid tasks

There is no legit reason to have the producer running
if there are no tasks running.

Also improved the test coverage.

Change-Id: I05a69cf80785c912aaef2e29bfc0a1e5d57ceb6c

commit_message:
Fix import conversion for GLOBAL_VENV

This fixes import conversion in the affected jobs properly by setting
the python interpreter to the one in the venv. When we spawn external
commands they actually spawn a python interpreter to use an oslo
module to do the exec, and we need to do that with our venv's python.

Note this reverts the change in:

I073216d1bbddbd3bdecd2b135e4c291f7a4d9abe

As it is no longer necessary.

Change-Id: I37947192a0688c0d819ebcfc94621ff509f2d81d

commit_message:
Use DevStack VENV path

DevStack is moving to adopt VENV to manage its python versions.
However, CloudKittty DevStack integration was not using the
DevStack VENV variable. This, in turn, causes issues with tempest
tests, as they are based on a DevStack deployment.

We need to merge this patch to fix the tempest tests.

Change-Id: I17de617557fb86c002814941325d71e3c08e0e72

commit_message:
[CI] Run a ml2/ovs job

tempest-integrated-networking setups ml2/ovn and that
doesn't uses os-ken library. Let's run a ml2/ovs specific
job instead.

Change-Id: I4264e51b563c8f012f7263275ccbb265e7fb0409

subject: docs: Migrate volume commands to autoprogram-cliff
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-05-17 12:03:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/329caaa9e3770b722cfb8220b11289f1c8892e78', 'message': "docs: Migrate volume commands to autoprogram-cliff

There are a few outstanding commands. Migrate them in one fell swoop. We
do lose a small bit of information about commands that are only
supported in block storage API version 2.0 or later, but who cares about
block storage API version 1.0 these days?

On a related note, we also use the 'openstack.volume.v3' entrypoint
rather than the v2 one since that's more relevant nowadays and the code
is pretty much identical.

Change-Id: Ide9d65596847d3f855981ff4ec57eeaeea6667a7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
docs: Migrate volume commands to autoprogram-cliff

There are a few outstanding commands. Migrate them in one fell swoop. We
do lose a small bit of information about commands that are only
supported in block storage API version 2.0 or later, but who cares about
block storage API version 1.0 these days?

On a related note, we also use the 'openstack.volume.v3' entrypoint
rather than the v2 one since that's more relevant nowadays and the code
is pretty much identical.

Change-Id: Ide9d65596847d3f855981ff4ec57eeaeea6667a7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

This can be used in case collisions between project names exist. *Volume version 2 only* .. option:: --encryption-provider <provider> Set the encryption provider format for this volume type (e.g "luks" or "plain") (admin only) This option is required when setting encryption type of a volume. Consider using other encryption options such as: :option:`--encryption-cipher`, :option:`--encryption-key-size` and :option:`--encryption-control-location` .. option:: --encryption-cipher <cipher> Set the encryption algorithm or mode for this volume type (e.g "aes-xts-plain64") (admin only) .. option:: --encryption-key-size <key-size> Set the size of the encryption key of this volume type (e.g "128" or "256") (admin only) .. option:: --encryption-control-location <control-location> Set the notional service where the encryption is performed ("front-end" or "back-end") (admin only) The default value for this option is "front-end" when setting encryption type of a volume. Consider using other encryption options such as: :option:`--encryption-cipher`, :option:`--encryption-key-size` and :option:`--encryption-provider` .. _volume_type_create-name: .. describe:: <name> Volume type name volume type delete ------------------ Delete volume type(s) .. program:: volume type delete .. code:: bash openstack volume type delete <volume-type> [<volume-type> ...] .. _volume_type_delete-volume-type: .. describe:: <volume-type> Volume type(s) to delete (name or ID) volume type list ---------------- List volume types .. program:: volume type list .. code:: bash openstack volume type list [--long] [--default | --public | --private] [--encryption-type] .. option:: --long List additional fields in output .. option:: --public List only public types *Volume version 2 only* .. option:: --private List only private types (admin only) *Volume version 2 only* .. option:: --default List the default volume type *Volume version 2 only* .. option:: --encryption-type Display encryption information for each volume type (admin only) volume type set --------------- Set volume type properties .. program:: volume type set .. code:: bash openstack volume type set [--name <name>] [--description <description>] [--property <key=value> [...] ] [--project <project>] [--project-domain <project-domain>] [--encryption-provider <provider>] [--encryption-cipher <cipher>] [--encryption-key-size <key-size>] [--encryption-control-location <control-location>] <volume-type> .. option:: --name <name> Set volume type name .. versionadded:: 2 .. option:: --description <description> Set volume type description .. versionadded:: 2 .. option:: --project <project> Set volume type access to project (name or ID) (admin only) *Volume version 2 only* .. option:: --project-domain <project-domain> Domain the project belongs to (name or ID). This can be used in case collisions between project names exist. .. option:: --property <key=value> Set a property on this volume type (repeat option to set multiple properties) .. option:: --encryption-provider <provider> Set the encryption provider format for this volume type (e.g "luks" or "plain") (admin only) This option is required when setting encryption type of a volume for the first time. Consider using other encryption options such as: :option:`--encryption-cipher`, :option:`--encryption-key-size` and :option:`--encryption-control-location` .. option:: --encryption-cipher <cipher> Set the encryption algorithm or mode for this volume type (e.g "aes-xts-plain64") (admin only) .. option:: --encryption-key-size <key-size> Set the size of the encryption key of this volume type (e.g "128" or "256") (admin only) .. option:: --encryption-control-location <control-location> Set the notional service where the encryption is performed ("front-end" or "back-end") (admin only) The default value for this option is "front-end" when setting encryption type of a volume for the first time. Consider using other encryption options such as: :option:`--encryption-cipher`, :option:`--encryption-key-size` and :option:`--encryption-provider` .. _volume_type_set-volume-type: .. describe:: <volume-type> Volume type to modify (name or ID) volume type show ---------------- Display volume type details .. program:: volume type show .. code:: bash openstack volume type show [--encryption-type] <volume-type> .. option:: --encryption-type Display encryption information of this volume type (admin only) .. _volume_type_show-volume-type: .. describe:: <volume-type> Volume type to display (name or ID) volume type unset ----------------- Unset volume type properties .. program:: volume type unset .. code:: bash openstack volume type unset [--property <key> [...] ] [--project <project>] [--project-domain <project-domain>] [--encryption-type] <volume-type> .. option:: --property <key> Property to remove from volume type (repeat option to remove multiple properties) .. option:: --project <project> Removes volume type access from project (name or ID) (admin only) *Volume version 2 only* .. option:: --project-domain <project-domain> Domain the project belongs to (name or ID). This can be used in case collisions between project names exist. *Volume version 2 only* .. option:: --encryption-type Remove the encryption type for this volume type (admin only) .. _volume_type_unset-volume-type: .. describe:: <volume-type> Volume type to modify (name or ID)

This has been unused since we switched to discovery way back in change
I11c16d37d3ab3d77bed3a0bcbd98f1fa33b9555f.

commit_message:
docs: Add examples of common auth methods

Took me a bit to figure out how to do token auth today. Document it.

Change-Id: I3edce59efd5ca5a6e31eef8c7cf3cf255234c82e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/73/887973/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: the :ref:`Authentication using federation. <manpage>` Examples -------- .. todo: It would be nice to add more examples here, particularly for complicated things like oauth2 ``v3password`` ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Using ``clouds.yaml``: .. code-block:: yaml clouds: demo: auth: auth_url: http://openstack.dev/identity project_name: admin project_domain_name: default user_domain_name: default username: admin password: password auth_type: v3password or, using command line options: .. code-block:: bash $ openstack \ --os-auth-url "http://openstack.dev/identity" \ --os-project-name admin \ --os-project-domain-name default \ --os-user-domain-name default \ --os-auth-type=v3password \ --os-username admin \ --os-password password \ server list or, using environment variables: .. code-block:: bash $ export OS_AUTH_URL="http://openstack.dev/identity" $ export OS_PROJECT_NAME=admin $ export OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME=default $ export OS_AUTH_TYPE=v3password $ export OS_USERNAME=admin $ export OS_PASSWORD=password $ openstack server list ``v3applicationcredential`` ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Using ``clouds.yaml``: .. code-block:: yaml clouds: demo: auth: auth_url: http://openstack.dev/identity application_credential_id: ${APP_CRED_ID} application_credential_secret: ${APP_CRED_SECRET} auth_type: v3applicationcredential or, using command line options: .. code-block:: bash $ openstack \ --os-auth-url "http://openstack.dev/identity" \ --os-auth-type=v3applicationcredential \ --os-application-credential-id=${APP_CRED_ID} \ --os-application-credential-secret=${APP_CRED_SECRET} server list or, using environment variables: .. code-block:: bash $ export OS_AUTH_URL="http://openstack.dev/identity" $ export OS_AUTH_TYPE=v3applicationcredential $ export OS_APPLICATION_CREDENTIAL_ID=${APP_CRED_ID} $ export OS_APPLICATION_CREDENTIAL_SECRET=${APP_CRED_SECRET} $ openstack server list .. note:: You can generate application credentials using the :prog:`openstack application credential create` command: .. code-block:: bash $ readarray -t lines <<< $(openstack application credential create test -f value -c id -c secret) $ APP_CRED_ID=${lines[0]} $ APP_CRED_SECRET=${lines[1]} ``v3token`` ~~~~~~~~~~~ Using ``clouds.yaml``: .. code-block:: yaml clouds: demo: auth: auth_url: http://openstack.dev/identity project_name: admin project_domain_name: default token: ${TOKEN} auth_type: v3token or, using command line options: .. code-block:: bash $ openstack \ --os-auth-url "http://openstack.dev/identity" \ --os-project-name admin \ --os-project-domain-name default \ --os-auth-type=v3token \ --os-token ${TOKEN} \ server list or, using environment variables: .. code-block:: bash $ export OS_AUTH_URL="http://openstack.dev/identity" $ export OS_PROJECT_NAME=admin $ export OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME=default $ export OS_AUTH_TYPE=v3token $ export OS_TOKEN=${TOKEN} $ openstack server list .. note:: You can generate tokens using the :prog:`openstack token issue` command: .. code-block:: bash $ TOKEN=$(openstack token issue -f value -c id)

subject: compute: Add support for microversion 2.92
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-05-02 13:25:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/dec8fe236590635a53efd11848d291288afbf7e3', 'message': 'compute: Add support for microversion 2.92

This removes support for server-side private key generation for SSH
keys. The generated keys were using the deprecated ssh-rsa format. Users
should generate keys client-side.

Change-Id: I00c92172b9067b9435cc561efe95893e78142c1c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-05-16 08:59:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/2ce0bdbdf388771514c7ab2830310312e3e6a9e7', 'message': 'compute: Add support for microversion 2.92

This removes support for server-side private key generation for SSH
keys. The generated keys were using the deprecated ssh-rsa format. Users
should generate keys client-side.

Change-Id: I00c92172b9067b9435cc561efe95893e78142c1c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2023-05-17 10:02:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/225c7893c7aad663544177d3ca42a6eb05378d6b', 'message': 'compute: Add support for microversion 2.92

This removes support for server-side private key generation for SSH
keys. The generated keys were using the deprecated ssh-rsa format. Users
should generate keys client-side.

All tests and examples are updated to ensure we generate SSH keypairs as
expected.

commit_message:
compute: Add support for microversion 2.92

This removes support for server-side private key generation for SSH
keys. The generated keys were using the deprecated ssh-rsa format. Users
should generate keys client-side.

All tests and examples are updated to ensure we generate SSH keypairs as
expected.

Change-Id: I00c92172b9067b9435cc561efe95893e78142c1c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/65/881965/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Add support for compute microversion 2.92, which removes support for server-side SSH key generation. The generated keys were in the ssh-rsa format, which is deprecated and disabled by default in recent versions of OpenSSH. Users should ensure that keys are generated client-side and provided via the ``public_key`` attribute when creating an ``openstack.compute.v2.Keypair`` resource.

commit_message:
Fix exception catch when volume mount fails

When we call nova.privsep.fs.mount(), we are catching
ProcessExecutionError() (an instance of a class) and that is not allowed
in python3.

This changes the except statement to catch ProcessExecutionError
(class) instead.

Closes-Bug: #1984736

Change-Id: I24a269f9809063f864a4f0443d6724dfa8703d9d

commit_message:
Updated serial configuration of bootloader

Here we propose an update to the bootloader element to allow more customization when serial console is necessary. The previous GRUB serial setup was static and fixed to unit 0 (COM1), but sometimes users want to set this to other units. In addition, README was updated to reflect changes. During the update, it was also discovered that Ubuntu and Debian have a /etc/default/grub.d folder which for their cloud images (used by e.g. the ubuntu element) contains files that would override anything set in /etc/default/grub as the files in /etc/default/grub.d is sourced after.
To make the serial setup comply with this configuration, we replaced the /etc/default/grub injections with injections to /etc/default/grub.d/99-dib-bootloader.cfg which should be sourced last with the current setup in the cloud images for Ubuntu and Debian.

Change-Id: Ie6c5d039542b4270983e18627a9d800b04e11383
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/84/875884/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Installs ``grub[2]`` on boot partition on the system by configuring ``/etc/default/grub`` and running ``grub2-mkconfig`` or ``grub-mkconfig`` depending on what is available. The ``GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT`` argument always contain ``console=tty0``, ``no_timer_check`` and an extra ``console`` is always appended. The extra console defaults to ``console=hvc0`` for PowerPC, ``console=ttyAMA0`` for ARM and ``console=ttyS0,115200`` for the rest. Its unit and speed can be modified with the arguments below. configuration. It defaults to ``nofb nomodeset``. * ``DIB_BOOTLOADER_GFX_PAYLOAD`` sets the ``gfxpayload`` to whatever is set here, which forces the linux kernel to use a particular mode. It defaults to ``auto``. Set this to ``text`` to enforce good serial behavior. * ``DIB_BOOTLOADER_SERIAL_CONSOLE_SPEED`` sets the speed of the serial port. It defaults to ``115200``. * ``DIB_BOOTLOADER_SERIAL_CONSOLE_UNIT`` sets the unit to be used. ``COM1`` is unit ``0``, while ``COM2`` is unit ``1`` etc. It defaults to ``0``. used as a console using a full string. This overrides anything set in ``DIB_BOOTLOADER_SERIAL_CONSOLE_SPEED`` and ``DIB_BOOTLOADER_SERIAL_CONSOLE_UNIT``.
deleted_lines: Installs ``grub[2]`` on boot partition on the system. configuration. It defaults to ``nofb nomodeset gfxpayload=text``. used as a console. It defaults to ``hvc0`` for PowerPC, ``ttyAMA0,115200`` for ARM64, otherwise ``ttyS0,115200``.

from pypi but instead should be installed from git.

commit_message:
Add 2 tls container params for Octavia Pools

This patch add 2 new pool options, which are 'ca_tls_container_ref' and
'crl_container_ref'.

'ca_tls_container_ref' will store the ca certificate used by backend
servers.
'crl_container_ref' will store the revocation list file.

Change-Id: I86277ff370e9ca04a22400348dbca90c63af55bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/16/890916/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'ca_tls_container_ref', 'crl_container_ref', #: Stores the ca certificate used by backend servers ca_tls_container_ref = resource.Body('ca_tls_container_ref') #: Stores the revocation list file crl_container_ref = resource.Body('crl_container_ref')

commit_message:
Fix heat stack _action function to handle exception

The openstack orchestration `stack actions API` sends 400, 401, 404 as client error reponse.
Currently, stack._action() function cannot handle there error responses.
So I fixed it as below.
- Changed stack._action() to handle exception from post request
- Added test cases for BadRequsetException and NotFoundException in "test_check" unit test

Change-Id: I464b19258d999eee9919332a519f870ada4e3017

Missing load balancer health monitors fix

In api and etcd load balancer templates we define if Octavia
load balancer healthchecks should be enabled. Corrected
octavia_lb_healthcheck parameter value comparison.

Change-Id: Icee8be92ea3e3121934645049b81b79be9bd046a

commit_message:
Render 'identity.authenticate' meter name with correct status

jsonpath-rw-ext uses operator.add for "+" and operator.sub for "-". operator.add can do string concatenation, but operator.sub cannot do string subtraction. so the original hack does not work, perhaps we should use sub to get an empty string.

Closes-Bug: 2032882

Change-Id: I9183a4a9f9cc345d8b4508bd7de1afa0eccd89d1
(cherry picked from commit 144827d304bbd7ffc9aa8165a4725d6fd00d73cc)
(cherry picked from commit a0c56384b580a9a7f647d372e86392525b5731f3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/00/890500/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: $.payload.outcome.`sub(/.*/, )` + 'identity.authenticate.' + $.payload.outcome

commit_message:
Honor undercloud_custom_env_files for oooq deployments

In oooq deployments undercloud_custom_env_files is used
to set custom_env_files in undercloud.conf but
undercloud_custom_env_files is not getting honored
during upgrade, this patch fixes it.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/853503

Change-Id: Iab1865710d424796fb1109a2ef303514bb32de9c

self.controller.add_image_location, '3a4560a1-e585-443e-9b39-553b46ec92d1', 'http://spam.com/') def test_get_image_locations(self): image_id = 'a2b83adc-888e-11e3-8872-78acc0b951d8' with mock.patch.object(common_utils, 'has_version') as mock_has_version: mock_has_version.return_value = True locations = self.controller.get_image_locations(image_id) self.assertEqual(2, len(locations)) def test_get_image_location_not_supported(self): with mock.patch.object(common_utils, 'has_version') as mock_has_version: mock_has_version.return_value = False self.assertRaises(exc.HTTPNotImplemented, self.controller.get_image_locations, '3a4560a1-e585-443e-9b39-553b46ec92d1')

commit_message:
Prevent duplicate/unwanted ceph rgw deployments

The reason of this patch is to avoid TripleO to redeploy RGW during FFU,
but in general, this change prevents a redeploy during a stack update in
case the daemon is found.
This means that after day1, an existing RGW deployment can't be updated
at all using TripleO, and should be done via cephadm cli [1].

This patch adds a generic task check_service.yaml to
capture the details of a specific service.

This patch applies same pattern for mds, monitoring stack
and dashboard services.
[1] https://docs.ceph.com/en/quincy/cephadm/operations/

Resolves: rhbz#2229931
Change-Id: Id1e2c2c04f686939824801d3219c21aab4af25bb

commit_message:
Missing load balancer health monitors fix

In api and etcd load balancer templates we define if Octavia
load balancer healthchecks should be enabled. Corrected
octavia_lb_healthcheck parameter value comparison.

Closes-bug: #2015393
Change-Id: Icee8be92ea3e3121934645049b81b79be9bd046a

commit_message:
Send ovn heatbeat more often.

This change modifies the metadata agent heatbeat
to use a random offset with a max delay of 10 seconds.

The orgial reason for the current logic was to mitigate
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1991817
so the logic to spread the heatbeats is maintained but
we now set an upper bound on the delay.

Close-Bug: #2020215
Change-Id: I4d382793255520b9c44ca2aaacebcbda9a432dde
(cherry picked from commit 5e0c102830a18850e35f746160867613e96d1dbc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/92/892592/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: delay = 0 if self.first_run: # We occasionally see port binding failed errors due to # the ml2 driver refusing to bind the port to a dead agent. # if all agents heartbeat at the same time, they will all # cause a load spike on the server. To mitigate that we # need to spread out the load by introducing a random delay. # clamp the max delay between 3 and 10 seconds. max_delay = max(min(cfg.CONF.agent_down_time // 3, 10), 3) delay = randint(0, max_delay) LOG.debug("Delaying updating chassis table for %s seconds", delay) timer = threading.Timer(delay, _update_chassis, [self, row])
deleted_lines: if self.first_run: interval = 0 interval = randint(0, cfg.CONF.agent_down_time // 2) LOG.debug("Delaying updating chassis table for %s seconds", interval) timer = threading.Timer(interval, _update_chassis, [self, row])

subject: Fix post failures causing by image conversion failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-23 08:57:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/b47915208330b4b908884f14f3ac31f74c735a12', 'message': "Fix post failures causing by image conversion failure

CI jobs tempest-integrated-storage-import-standalone,
tempest-integrated-storage-import and
glance-multistore-cinder-import were failing while converting
image from qcow2 to raw. The failures were caused by changing
default behavior of Devstack and installing everything in global
virtualenv patch [1].

As a temporary workaround, let's set the GLOBAL_VENV to false
for these jobs.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/891248

Change-Id: I073216d1bbddbd3bdecd2b135e4c291f7a4d9abe
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-08-23 15:08:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/edc1895392f570067829c71c6fe9a64cc3aa1d05', 'message': "Fix post failures causing by image conversion failure

CI jobs tempest-integrated-storage-import-standalone,
tempest-integrated-storage-import and
glance-multistore-cinder-import were failing while converting
image from qcow2 to raw. The failures were caused by changing
default behavior of Devstack and installing everything in global
virtualenv patch [1].

This fixes import conversion in the affected jobs properly by setting
the python interpreter to the one in the venv. When we spawn external
commands they actually spawn a python interpreter to use an oslo
module to do the exec, and we need to do that with our venv's python.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/891248

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I073216d1bbddbd3bdecd2b135e4c291f7a4d9abe
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2023-08-23 17:45:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/af93fa8ab936e8563bd687d79f78d8935e7aeddb', 'message': "Fix post failures causing by image conversion failure

CI jobs tempest-integrated-storage-import-standalone,
tempest-integrated-storage-import and
glance-multistore-cinder-import were failing while converting
image from qcow2 to raw. The failures were caused by changing
default behavior of Devstack and installing everything in global
virtualenv patch [1].

This fixes import conversion in the affected jobs properly by setting
the python interpreter to the one in the venv. When we spawn external
commands they actually spawn a python interpreter to use an oslo
module to do the exec, and we need to do that with our venv's python.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/891248

commit_message:
Fix post failures causing by image conversion failure

CI jobs tempest-integrated-storage-import-standalone,
tempest-integrated-storage-import and
glance-multistore-cinder-import were failing while converting
image from qcow2 to raw. The failures were caused by changing
default behavior of Devstack and installing everything in global
virtualenv patch [1].

This fixes import conversion in the affected jobs properly by setting
the python interpreter to the one in the venv. When we spawn external
commands they actually spawn a python interpreter to use an oslo
module to do the exec, and we need to do that with our venv's python.

Finally, this bumps the swap size for the storage-import jobs to 8G
to help account for the additional overhead of running another glance
worker, which is required for that configuration. This matches other
jobs with additional overhead (i.e. the ceph ones).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/891248

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/892571
Change-Id: I073216d1bbddbd3bdecd2b135e4c291f7a4d9abe

commit_message:
[ffwd3] Upgrade ovn_controller ahead

Normally we would use deployment steps to upgrade service
but ovn_controller has to be upgraded before ovn_dbs and
ovn_dbs gets deployed in step3 same as ovn_controller.

Originally we moved ovn_controller from step4 to step3 to
resolve the issue but this still creates race. Solution
would be to move all steps in ovn_dbs one up or ovn_controller
one lower but all in all steps in tripleo don't give us enough
flexibility for this.

We already have hack dance around ovn_controller during update
which forces the ovn_controller as external update run before
all other actions during update. We can reuse this code and just
trigger it during upgrade.

Resolves: rhbz#2229761

Change-Id: I7a04ce318038ea632261726b198ef9b2497446dd

commit_message:
Use service role also in test_server_external_events

Server external events API is service-to-service API
and nova is changing its default permission to 'service'
role
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/892633

To pass test on new defaults as well as old defaults
testing jobs, we need to use service role also in
the Tempest creds. Once nova change is merged then we
can use only service role to access this API.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/892633
Change-Id: Idff5879941ab1e11a527f2fd3c6577a51f41433c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/40/892640/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(gmann): Remove the admin access to service user # once nova change the default of this API to service # role. To merge the nova changing the policy default # we need to use token with admin as well as service # role and later we can use only service token. credentials = ['primary', 'admin', ['service_user', 'admin', 'service']] client = self.os_service_user.server_external_events_client
